[Feasible]

T1213-Data from Information Repositories

Method 1:
Packages Used: requests

Step 1: Install the requests package (if not already installed)
import requests

Step 2: Implement a function to gather data from a Confluence repository
def get_confluence_data():
    # Specify the URL of the Confluence repository
    url = "https://example.com/confluence"
    
    # Make a GET request to the Confluence repository
    response = requests.get(url)
    
    # Process the response (e.g., parse and extract valuable information)
    if response.status_code == 200:
        # Extract valuable information from the response
        data = response.text
        # Process the data further (e.g., extract specific data points)
        # ...
        return data
    else:
        # Handle any errors that occurred during the request
        return None

Step 3: Call the function to get Confluence data
confluence_data = get_confluence_data()
print(confluence_data)

Method 2:
Packages Used: selenium, webdriver_manager

Step 1: Install the selenium and webdriver_manager packages (if not already installed)
import time
from selenium import webdriver
from webdriver_manager.chrome import ChromeDriverManager

Step 2: Implement a function to gather data from a SharePoint repository
def get_sharepoint_data():
    # Specify the URL of the SharePoint repository
    url = "https://example.com/sharepoint"
    
    # Configure and start a Chrome WebDriver
    driver = webdriver.Chrome(ChromeDriverManager().install())
    
    # Open the SharePoint repository in the WebDriver
    driver.get(url)
    
    # Wait for the page to load (you may need to adjust the sleep duration based on the page load time)
    time.sleep(5)
    
    # Get the page source (contains valuable information)
    data = driver.page_source
    
    # Close the WebDriver
    driver.quit()
    
    return data

Step 3: Call the function to get SharePoint data
sharepoint_data = get_sharepoint_data()
print(sharepoint_data)

Method 3:
Packages Used: gitpython

Step 1: Install the gitpython package (if not already installed)
import git

Step 2: Implement a function to gather data from a code repository (e.g., Github)
def get_code_repository_data():
    # Specify the URL of the code repository
    url = "https://github.com/example/project"
    
    # Clone or open the code repository
    repo = git.Repo.clone_from(url, "/path/to/clone/repository")
    
    # Process the repository (e.g., analyze source code, extract information)
    # ...
    
    # Return the extracted information
    return "Extracted information"

Step 3: Call the function to get code repository data
code_repository_data = get_code_repository_data()
print(code_repository_data)
